A **sack** is a type of [tool](/wiki/Tool "Tool") that appears in *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")*. It is a type of container that is made of [cloth](/wiki/Cloth "Cloth"), and appears as a [bag](/wiki/Bag "Bag") when [unidentified](/wiki/Identification "Identification").

[ ]

## Generation

- *Main article: [Container#Generation](/wiki/Container#Generation "Container")*

[Archaeologists](/wiki/Archaeologist "Archaeologist") and [Rogues](/wiki/Rogue "Rogue") start each game with an uncursed empty sack.

Sacks make up 7⁄200 of all randomly-generated tools in the dungeon and [Gehennom](/wiki/Gehennom "Gehennom"), and are always generated uncursed outside of [bones](/wiki/Bones "Bones") levels and [trap](/wiki/Trap "Trap") "bones". Randomly generated sacks may contain a random item.[\[1\]](#cite_note-1)

General [stores](/wiki/Store "Store") and hardware stores can sell sacks, whose contents are randomly generated as normal.

The [statue](/wiki/Statue "Statue") of [Perseus](/wiki/Perseus "Perseus") on [Medusa's Island](/wiki/Medusa%27s_Island "Medusa's Island") has a 1⁄2 chance (50%) of containing a sack.[\[2\]](#cite_note-2)[\[3\]](#cite_note-3)[\[4\]](#cite_note-4)[\[5\]](#cite_note-5)

## Description

Sacks can be used to store items as with other containers, and protect their contents from [fire](/wiki/Fire "Fire"), [cold](/wiki/Cold "Cold"), [shock](/wiki/Shock "Shock"), and [cancellation](/wiki/Cancellation "Cancellation"). Monsters will not open sacks or otherwise interact with their contents except for the [gelatinous cube](/wiki/Gelatinous_cube "Gelatinous cube"), which can eat a sack it picks up, with the contents being immediately engulfed (but not eaten) by the cube afterward. As a cloth container, a sack will rot away if [buried](/wiki/Buried "Buried") underground.

A sack that is [thrown](/wiki/Thrown "Thrown") or [kicked](/wiki/Kick "Kick"), or else is dropped while [levitating](/wiki/Levitating "Levitating") or on a down [stair](/wiki/Stair "Stair") may break or damage [fragile](/wiki/Fragile "Fragile") contents, and being submerged in water will [wet](/wiki/Wet "Wet") and damage vulnerable contents.

*The following information pertains to an upcoming version ([NetHack 3.7.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.7.0 "NetHack 3.7.0")). If this version is now released, please verify that it is still accurate, then update the page to incorporate this information.*

Monsters can loot sacks and take out their contents.

## Strategy

Sacks are the simplest and lightest form of container, and while they offer relatively minimal protection compared to an [oilskin sack](/wiki/Oilskin_sack "Oilskin sack") or [bag of holding](/wiki/Bag_of_holding "Bag of holding"), they are still sufficient for managing inventory throughout the game, and can be [greased](/wiki/Greased "Greased") to offer some additional protection against water damage. Even after obtaining a bag of holding, a sack can still be of some use to store emergency items, such as [holy water](/wiki/Holy_water "Holy water") or a [scroll of scare monster](/wiki/Scroll_of_scare_monster "Scroll of scare monster"), separately from the rest of the character's items to #[tip](/wiki/Tip "Tip") them out when needed - the most important of these uses is storing a [wand of cancellation](/wiki/Wand_of_cancellation "Wand of cancellation"), which causes an item-destroying explosion if placed into a bag of holding; the wand may also be used to uncurse a bag of holding if necessary.

A sack can also be used to contain a bag of holding and protect it against being cursed as well, and nested sacks with a bag of holding at the core also offer the possibility of reducing the weight of loot for extra points when you ascend - the risk of an explosion is still possible, albeit with a reduced chance. See [the bag of holding section on nesting](/wiki/Bag_of_holding#Nesting_bags_of_holding "Bag of holding") for more on this tactic.

## History

The sack first appears in [NetHack 3.0.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.0.0 "NetHack 3.0.0").

## Variants

Some variants of *NetHack* may change how sacks function - a common quality-of-life addition is to allow placing a sack or other container on an [altar](/wiki/Altar "Altar") to identify the [beatitude](/wiki/Beatitude "Beatitude") of both the container and its contents. Variants that implement [object materials](/wiki/Object_materials "Object materials") may alter a container's properties based on its material.

### SLASH'EM

In [SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM"), [upgrading](/wiki/Upgrading "Upgrading") a [sack]() has a 4⁄5 chance of producing an oilskin sack, and will otherwise produce a bag of holding - this makes the other bags more obtainable for most characters.

[Player monster](/wiki/Player_monster "Player monster") [archeologists](/wiki/Archeologist_\(player_monster\) "Archeologist (player monster)") and [rogues](/wiki/Rogue_\(player_monster\) "Rogue (player monster)") are generated with sacks.

All of the above information also applies to [SlashTHEM](/wiki/SlashTHEM "SlashTHEM").

### dNetHack

In [dNetHack](/wiki/DNetHack "DNetHack"), [Pirates](/wiki/Pirate "Pirate") know the sack as a **ditty bag**.

[Andromalius](/wiki/Andromalius "Andromalius") is a [spirit](/wiki/Spirits_\(dNetHack\) "Spirits (dNetHack)") whose binding ritual can use a sack as one of the two items placed in his seal, and using two non-sack items in the binding ritual may generate a sack as the third item the character receives if they successfully bind him.

[Hill giants](/wiki/Hill_giant "Hill giant") that generate on the revamped [Healer quest](/index.php?title=Healer_quest/dNetHack\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Healer quest/dNetHack (page does not exist)") are always generated with a sack special-cased to contain various live victims of a plague that the [Healer](/wiki/Healer "Healer") is sent to cure during the [Quest](/wiki/Quest "Quest").

The [Grue's Cavern](/wiki/Grue%27s_Cavern "Grue's Cavern") generates a sack containing a [wrathful](/index.php?title=Wrathful\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Wrathful (page does not exist)") [silver](/wiki/Silver "Silver") [elven broadsword](/wiki/Elven_broadsword "Elven broadsword") among the second pile of treasures placed at level creation.

### FIQHack

In [FIQHack](/wiki/FIQHack "FIQHack"), monsters can carry and utilize sacks.

### SpliceHack

In [SpliceHack](/wiki/SpliceHack "SpliceHack"), [Cartomancers](/wiki/Cartomancer "Cartomancer") know the sack as a **card bag**.

A sack can be combined with a [can of grease](/wiki/Can_of_grease "Can of grease") at a [furnace](/wiki/Furnace "Furnace") to create an oilskin sack.

### notdNetHack

In [notdNetHack](/wiki/NotdNetHack "NotdNetHack") and [notnotdNetHack](/wiki/NotnotdNetHack "NotnotdNetHack"), in addition to dNetHack details, Andromalius generates with a sack when he is summoned by an [Illithanachronounbinder](/wiki/Illithanachronounbinder "Illithanachronounbinder").

### EvilHack

In [EvilHack](/wiki/EvilHack "EvilHack"), monsters can carry and utilize sacks. [Tortle](/wiki/Tortle_\(starting_race\) "Tortle (starting race)") characters in roles that start with a sack will receive an oilskin sack instead.

[Hobbit pickpockets](/wiki/Hobbit_pickpocket "Hobbit pickpocket") have a 1⁄6 chance of generating with a sack. Low-level [player monster](/wiki/Player_monster_\(EvilHack\) "Player monster (EvilHack)") archeologists and rogues that are not [tortles](/index.php?title=Tortle_\(monster_attribute\)\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Tortle (monster attribute) (page does not exist)") are generated with sacks.

### Hack'EM

In [Hack'EM](/wiki/Hack%27EM "Hack'EM"), upgrading a sack produces an oilskin sack, and upgrading a bag of holding will produce a sack; dipping a [bag of rats](/wiki/Bag_of_rats "Bag of rats") or [bag of tricks](/wiki/Bag_of_tricks "Bag of tricks") in a [potion of amnesia](/wiki/Potion_of_amnesia "Potion of amnesia") will downgrade them to a sack.

Monsters can carry and utilize sacks as in EvilHack.

## Encyclopedia entry

"Now, this third handkerchief," Mein Herr proceeded, "has also four edges, which you can trace continuously round and round: all you need do is to join its four edges to the four edges of the opening. The Purse is then complete, and its outer surface--"  
"I see!" Lady Muriel eagerly interrupted. "Its outer surface will be continuous with its inner surface! But it will take time. I'll sew it up after tea." She laid aside the bag, and resumed her cup of tea. "But why do you call it Fortunatus's Purse, Mein Herr?"  
The dear old man beamed upon her, with a jolly smile, looking more exactly like the Professor than ever. "Don't you see, my child--I should say Miladi? Whatever is inside that Purse, is outside it; and whatever is outside it, is inside it. So you have all the wealth of the world in that leetle Purse!"

\[ Sylvie and Bruno Concluded, by Lewis Carroll ]
